description: Job descriptionGreetings from Infomerica!!!We have a very exciting opportunity for IT Project Manager.Please review the JD given below, if your profile is apt and if you can join immediately or within 15 days please share your updated profile along with the following details to nabeela@infomericainc.com.1. Your Current CTC2. Expected CTC3. Notice Period4. Total Exp5. Relevant Exp6. Do you have any offer in hand? if yes mention the value of the offer7. Current location8. Preferred location (Job location is Bangalore and on Hybrid mode) please apply only if you are willing to work from Bangalore9. Date of Birth10. Your convenient time to attend Interview11. Are you having minimum 3 to 5 years of exp in IT PMMust have• Minimum 5 years of experience as IT Project Manager• Must have experience leading cross-functional projects and initiatives• Prior development experience• Proficient in Agile methodology with an ability to adapt quickly to changing technology requirements• Proven Strong project management skill• Highly organized and ability to navigate fast-paced and rapidly evolving environments• Hands on experience with JIRA, MS Office, MS Project and Project Planning tools• SDLC Knowledge• Good organizational and time management skills• Excellent interpersonal skills• High level of attention to detail• Outstanding spoken and written communication skills• PMP CertifiedGood to have -• Agile, SCRUM, Lean Certification• Data warehousing project experience• Hadoop ecosystem project experienceKey Responsibilities - This role will be responsible for a high volume of tasks including complex calendar management and scheduling, effectively prioritizing amidst a flood of requests ensuring appropriate level of urgency is given.• Work closely with technical team, monitor tasks and project progress and handle issues.• Manage daily SCRUM meetings.• Develop, implement, and review methods to assess quality and efficiency of work performed by team, including metrics, internal process improvement, Operating Procedures, and Work Instructions• Provide delivery of projects on time and quality service.• Responsible for allocating and handling the tasks properly so as to ensure optimum workforce utilization.• People management - Interacting effectively with employees and prioritizing meetings.• Successfully overseeing multiple, concurrent projects• Holding review meetings to monitor progress of the projects as per schedule, ensuring timely completion and delivery of the projects.• Perform as an agile thought-leader, constantly improving how we deliver, championing a positive culture and fostering agile frameworks.• Risk and issue management, change management, communications and stakeholder management• Recommend course of action regarding project issues/concerns, implement mitigation plans, then escalate risks and issues to senior IT management as necessary• Work with financial stakeholders to ensure that the project remains within financial and regulatory guidelines• Support other groups as needed in production of Business Case• Responsibilities include planning, assigning, and directing work• Perform project closeout, including Lessons Learned activity RoleIT Project Manager,Industry TypeIT Services & Consulting,Functional AreaProject & Program Management,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryTechnology / ITEducationUG :Any GraduateKey SkillsIT Program Managementit project management

description: Job descriptionJob Description:Project managers are responsible for planning and overseeing projects to ensure they are completed in a timely fashion and within budget. Project managers plan and designate project resources, prepare budgets, monitor progress, and keep stakeholders informed the entire way.RESPONSIBILITIES: •	End to end Project execution covering the entire SDLC cycle.•	Determine and define the Project scope, out of scope and objectives.•	Understand the various organizational factors, assumptions, constraints, and boundaries in which the project needs to be executed.•	Host the kickoff meeting with project stakeholders which includes Customer, Other IT vendors and Project team.•	Understand the dynamics and create the Project planning and maintain the same.•	Work breakdown structure for the team to be maintained and tracked.•	Identification of Risk, Issues, Dependencies beforehand and work towards mitigation.•	Host Weekly Status calls with various project stakeholders. •	Participate in the Project Review, Audits, Forecasting, Timesheet tracking, Billing, and Invoicing. •	Manage and lead the project team which includes Business Analyst, Development team, testing team.•	Maintain relevant trackers, Checklist, and knowledge documents during SDLC cycle.•	Maintain good rapport project stakeholders and communicate the project status appropriately on time.•	Monitor progress, understand dynamics, and adjust the plan. •	Manage project escalation and changes in Scope.•	Measure project performance to identify areas of improvement.•	Utilize industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout the entire project execution. SKILLS & EXPERIENCE Essential Qualification:Minimum knowledge, skills, abilities needed.•	Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or Business management.•	Overall, 8 to 12 years of experience in IT industry with hands on Project management experience for 2 to 5 years •	End to end project management experience covering but not limited to Project Planning and Execution, People Management, Escalation Management, Change Management, Risk Management, Stakeholder Management and Knowledge Management.•	Should be Analytical, detail oriented and possesses good communication skills.•	Strong interpersonal skills and proven ability to complete the projects to the given scope, budget, and timeline without compromising on the quality. •	Strong knowledge on Project management software tools, Methodologies, and best practices.•	Experience in Contract preparation.•	PMP (Project Management Professional)•	Knowledge and work experience in Agile methodology is added advantage.•	Domain knowledge in any of industry and experience in handing Pega projects is a plus.Preferred Qualification:Candidates with these skills will be given preferential consideration.•	Prince2 certification is desirable. RoleIT Project Manager,Industry TypeIT Services & Consulting,Functional AreaProject & Program Management,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryTechnology / ITEducationUG :Any GraduatePG :Any PostgraduateDoctorate :Any DoctorateKey SkillsIT Project managementSDLCPMPPrince 2Software projectsSkills highlighted with ‘‘ are preferred keyskills

company: Pearson is the world's leading education company. From pre-school to high school, early learning to professional certification, our curriculum materials, multimedia learning tools and testing programs help to educate millions of people worldwide - more than any other private enterprise. Learn more at www.pearson.com (Global Website) Pearson India provides end-to-end education solutions in the space of K-12 (schools), Higher Education and Professional segment with a focus on technological innovations. For more information logon to www.pearson.co.in (India Website)Pearson opens up a world of opportunities in education by offering effective, accessible and personalised learning for all kinds of people, in every walk of life. We are proud of the work we do because we believe learning helps people flourish. We combine our global reach with local knowledge and create world-class, integrated education solutions designed to meet individual learning needs. We aim for a judicious combination of contextualized learning and technology from across the world to ensure better learning outcomes.
description: Job description About Pearson We are the worlds learning company with more than 20,000 employees where we serve people in the community (nearly 200 countries).We combine world-class educational content and assessment, powered by services and technology, to enable more effective teaching andpersonalisedlearning at scale. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people.At Pearson, were committed to a world thats always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. Fromshaping lessons of the future,totakingassessment of learningonline, we are always re-examining the way peopleteach, tutor andlearn best. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires ustoalways be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology—and each other to surpass these boundaries—we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small. At Pearson, we believe in the power of difference. Harnessing the unique skills, perspectives, and backgrounds of every employee helps us foster innovation and create the most effective solutions for learners around the world. That’s why we’re committed to ensuring that diversity and inclusion are embedded into everything we do. We foster a work environment that’s inclusive and diverse and where our people can be themselves so we can reflect the customers and learners we serve. Pearson is regularly featured on the Forbes list of Bestemployer’s, we arerecognisedin the Best Employers for Diversity 2019 awards. Pearson is listed on both the London and New York stock exchanges (UK: PSON; NYSE: PSO) Pearson is delighted to be committed to the Race Charter, and to be confirmed by Stonewall in the Top 100 Employers LGBTQ+ in the UK. We are a Disability Confident committed employer and were recognised in the Best Employers for Diversity 2019 awards. We are featured on The Forbes list of Best D&I Employers and are a Working Mums Top Employer and Age Positive employer. Pearson is listed on both the London and New York Stock Exchanges (UK: PSON; NYSE: PSO).We are proud to offer an exceptional and supportive environment to develop your professional career. You can learn more about our diverse and inclusive culture here:https://pearson.jobs/pearson-life/#diversity Job Description Reporting to: Regional Manager- IndiaRole and Responsibilities Job Purpose This role is based within Pearson Workforce Skills vertical – in the Performance Zone. Pearson delivers career and skill-based qualifications and services in more than 50 countries, but we believe we are just scratching the surface in terms of meeting demand.  Our customer always comes first – be that the students who wants to develop their future success through education – Governments who are seeking to effectively skill their population - and employers and providers.  The Project Manager- Strategic Customers plays a pivotal role in driving the growth of Workforce Skills (WFS) - qualifications and services, positioning Pearson as an organisation dedicated to addressing the employability skills gap, driving higher technical skills. As the Project Manager- Strategic Customers - India, you will work closely with all the existing and future strategic customers and support in driving business development and day to day operations in line with deliverables as agreed in SLA with each one of them.Possessing excellent commercial skills, coupled with a good understanding of market, competitor analysis and customer needs, you will drive the growth and commercial success of the Pearson WFS portfolio; identifying emerging opportunities, leading on industry partnerships which drive the growth and expansion. Your excellent communication skills, and innate passion for whatever you do will also enable you to champion the Pearson brand with both internal and external stakeholders. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone with energy, innovation, and vision, who is looking to make a difference and be a key part of Pearson’s employability agenda. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you: Responsibilities for Project Manager – Strategic Customers- IndiaDetermine and define project scope and objectivesWork closely with Strategic customers in identifying resources needed to reach objectives and manage resources in an effective and efficient mannerDevelop and manage a detailed project schedule and work planTrack project progress in order to drive targets- revenue and collectionsProvide project updates on a consistent basis to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and progressManage project deliverables with both internal and external stake holders.Utilize industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout entire project executionMonitor progress and make adjustments as neededMeasure project performance to identify areas for improvementQualifications for Project ManagerBachelor's degree in computer science, business, or a related field5-8 years of project management and related experienceProject Management Professional (PMP) certification preferredProven ability to solve problems creativelyStrong familiarity with project management software tools, methodologies, and best practicesExperience seeing projects through the full life cycleExcellent analytical skillsStrong interpersonal skills and extremely resourcefulProven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget, and timelineRoleOther Program / Project Management - Other,Industry TypeIT Services & Consulting,Functional AreaProject & Program Management,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOther Program / Project ManagementEducationUG :Any GraduateKey SkillsProject Handlingbusiness developmentSalesProject Managementproject schedulingProject TrackingClient Interfacing SkillsClient InteractionsCorporate SalesProject CommunicationsSkills highlighted with ‘‘ are preferred keyskills

description: Job description The DR Analyst will be responsible for, and participate in, the annual functional recovery and disaster recovery exercise,   along with leading critical event coordination and communications.   SSGA Business Continuity information is present in dynamic areas and owned by many diverse groups, yet used for multiple repeatable processes.   The position will help with the detailed process for gathering, verifying, changing and uploading this information into various systems and repositories.  This work will aid in the recoverability process, for an actual disaster, and is required for compliance with bank policy, external agencies and regulatory requirements.   This position will also provide cross function support for Production stability initiatives and activities which roles into Disaster Recovery prevention.   The role will help to implement and drive continuous Production improvements activities across the organization       Special Duties:-   Provide support and oversight for yearly DR Exercise; help plan and leads the testing of recovery services and business support for multiple disciplines  Assist recovery support and business staff during a disaster; act as a coordinator during emergency situations  Responsible for helping develop, produce and maintain Disaster Recovery Management policies, standards, and guidelines. Maintain accurate and up to date documentation  Perform assessments and gap analysis of Disaster recovery plans to ensure efficient and seamless failover and failback .  Engage in GA transformation initiatives and should be able to drive enterprise level changes   Ability to drive and provide valuable suggestions in Major Incident calls pertaining to Incidents in order to resolve the issues quickly to avoid any impact to key deliverables and SLA  Maintain Call Tree Distribution process and employee contact information with quarterly testing and verification  Good understanding of ITIL Process and help users with questions regarding    PARTICIPATE IN AUDITS AND REGULATORY INQUIRES AS NECESSARY  Communicate and collaborate with support staff and senior management at all levels on the status of events and recovery services  Assist with day to day Incident and Problem Management areas supporting the Business and IT  Lead projects through the project lifecycles of initiation, planning, execution and closure  Metric Reporting - Produce monthly and yearly metrics to highlight areas of services and responsibilities  Administer and maintain SSGA s Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) processes used to care for SSGA s IT applications and business operations  Overall experience: 9+ Years  5 to 6 Years of relevant DR and Business Continuity experience  2 to 3 years if experience in Administer and maintaining Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)   3 to 6 years of experience in leading Production stability initiatives and good exposure to problem Management.  Good troubleshooting skills and technical knowledge with the ability to think creatively  Understanding of Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity principles with the ability to apply them in a consistent and effective manner  Basic knowledge of cloud based infrastructure operation  Intermediate ITIL or COBIT certification   CBCP or CDRP certified professionals are preferred    BROAD KNOWLEDGE OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SYSTEMS, CONCEPTS AND METHODOLOGIES  In the event of a disaster, serve as a liaison between the Crisis Management Team (Senior Management and the Business Continuity Teams)  Analytical background with an understanding of applications and infrastructure components able to apply that knowledge to Disaster Recovery    GOALS ORIENTED AND CAN WORK UNDER STRESS   Aptitude to establish relationships, engage and influence others in a diverse environment  Project Management experience preferred with good PC skills using Microsoft tools and work independently and as part of a team, leading multiple priorities with deadline    RISK MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL SERVICES EXPERIENCE IS A PLUS  Excellent oral and written communication is a must  RoleSystem Analyst,Industry TypeBanking,Functional AreaIT & Information Security,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryIT Infrastructure ServicesEducationUG :Any GraduatePG :Any PostgraduateKey SkillsApplication supportProject managementAnalyticalProblem managementTroubleshootingmicrosoftRisk managementInformation technologyFinancial servicesBusiness operations

description: Job description   JOB SUMMARY     The IT Project Manager II is responsible for leading enterprise-wide, cross- functional strategic initiatives. This role helps to manage the portfolio of IT Projects linked to Avery Dennison functional and IT Strategic plans.    This role is expected to work with project teams to ensure project efforts are executed in accordance with the defined organizational project standards, which align with industry best practices. This is an individual contributor role managing matrixed teams, and requires leadership and influencing capabilities.     ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES      Accountable for the oversight and reporting of strategic initiatives in the IT project portfolio      Ensures end results are of the highest caliber with a clearly articulated scope and quantifiable business benefit Directs large- scale, complex projects often involving multiple internal and external constituents and matrix partners to support the PMO      Accountable for one or more initiative      Rigorously manages project portfolio scope to ensure commitments are achieved within agreed on time, cost and quality parameters      Validates financial forecasts and provides on-going reconciliation of resources and other project related expenditures      Develops communication plans and interfaces to execute on responsibilities      Serves as a PMO SME in routinely briefing key stakeholders on different aspects of assigned initiatives      Represents project in various project governance and inter-department forums      Tracks milestones while developing, maintaining, and reporting on functional BU portfolio      Reviews and makes recommendations for improvements to project charters, project methodology execution, and related project management artifacts      Validates periodic status reports      Proposes recommendations and adjustments      SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY      Project Manager II (PMO) s are responsible for monitoring enterprise wide cross functional global / regional IT project portfolio.      The portfolio contains a variety of different types of projects including launching new products and services, application development, systems integration, BPO arrangements, process engineering and infrastructure upgrade and deployment.      This role will work with Project managers, Program Managers and Directors.     Qualifications      KNOWLEDGE and SKILLS REQUIREMENTS      Strong language skills in English are required      3 to 6 years of Project Management Experience in a Multinational Manufacturing Company preferred      Bachelors degree in business, finance or technology      PMP / PRINCE 2 certification preferred      Professional certifications and training including Six Sigma / ITIL or Lean are desirable      Proven ability to quickly earn the trust of sponsors and key stakeholders, mobilize and motivate team: set direction and approach: resolve conflict; deliver tough messages with grace: execute with limited information and ambiguity      Ability to navigate a highly matrixed organization effectively      Solid influencing skills      Sound business and technical acumen      Focused and versatile team player that is comfortable under pressure      Ability to communicate at all levels with clarity and precision both written and verbally      Strong presentation skills      Ability to remove barrier and enable teams to complete their objectives      Demonstrated, applied experience establishing and delivering complex projects      Exemplary core management skills including multiple aspects of PMBOK      Extensive knowledge and expertise in the use of Project Management and SDLC methodologies and tools         RoleProject Manager - Manufacturing,Industry TypePackaging & Containers,Functional AreaProject & Program Management,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryConstruction / ManufacturingEducationUG :B.B.A/ B.M.S in Management, Any GraduatePG :Any PostgraduateKey SkillsPresentation SkillsPmpLeanSix SigmaPmoProject ManagementScopeProject ManagerInterpersonal Skills
qualification: ['UG :B.B.A/ B.M.S in Management, Any Graduate', 'PG :Any Postgraduate']

description: Job description      Plan, organize, and direct the completion of IT projects while ensuring projects are on time, on budget, and within scope.     Develop, maintain, and revise proposals for assigned projects including project objectives, technologies, systems, information specifications, timelines, budget, and resources.     Set and track project milestones; manage and account for unforeseen delays, realign schedules and expectation as needed.     Establish and implement project communication plans, provide status updates to affected staff and stakeholders.     Collect, analyze, and summarize information and trends as needed to prepare project status reports.     Collaborate with IT and business leaders to define, prioritize and develop projects and programs.     Analyze project data and provide metrics and reports to IT leadership that drive actions to improve our project management capabilities.     Oversee day-to-day execution of the IT project management methodology, ensuring project managers have support needed to effectively deliver on project execution.     Assist in administration of project management system including generation of reports and metrics to be presented to the IT leadership team.     Work closely with the Business Partnership team to ensure demand management is supported.      Additional Details:      A Bachelor s degree in Business, Administration, Information Systems or a related field.     5+ years of experience working as an IT Project Manager, managing large scale, cross functional projects.     Exceptional interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication skills.     Must be able to effectively interact with all levels in the organization.     Outstanding organizational and administrative skills.     High energy, independent and self-motivated.     Oriented towards execution and solutions. Demonstrated ability to improve processes and to measure results.     Understanding of IT fundamentals and major technology platforms.     Must have intermediate/advanced level proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel).        Preferred Qualifications:      Hands on experience using administering Clarizen - global project portfolio management system.     Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification.     Experience in the Manufacturing industry.     SAP implementation or design experience.      RoleProject Manager - Manufacturing,Industry TypeEngineering & Construction,Functional AreaProject & Program Management,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryConstruction / ManufacturingEducationUG :Any Graduate, B.B.A/ B.M.S in ManagementPG :Any PostgraduateKey SkillsAdministrationMS Office PowerpointPMPIT project managementSAP implementationProject managementDemand managementIT projectsproject portfolio managementdigital strategy

Further to this the role will lead the establishment of an internal capability squad within CBAThe Senior Project Manager is required to maintain and build productive relationships with:Re-platform/CBA cloud capabilities squads spanning both onshore and offshoreKey Stakeholders, including Project Sponsor, Benefits Sponsor, Change Owner and Project Steering Group.Project and Program ManagersSolution Delivery roles including Solution Architects and Solution Delivery ManagersProject and Program teamsPMO'sBusiness unit (BU) and Group FinanceResource ManagersVendors and third party suppliersYour responsibilitiesYou will be expected to perform the following tasks and responsibilities in a manner consistent with CBAs Values and People Capabilities.CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:Adhere to the Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct sets the standards of behavior, actions and decisions we expect from our people.Support the onshore Program manager in establishment of offshore squads to deliver e2e migration capabilities.Managing large projects and programs of work to achieve the program/projects objectives and business benefitsEffectively manage relationships and communications with project stakeholders, including customers and delivery teamsStructure project team for success incorporating required skills from within the Group and sourcing resources from delivery partner organizationsCommunicate and report project activities, timelines, impacts and implications to project team members, stakeholders and staffDevelop robust and achievable project plans to manage the delivery of quality project deliverablesBalance schedule, cost and quality in reaching decisions relating to project  deliveryManage and report project expenditures and benefits realizationTrack and manage project activities and deliverables to achieve agreed outcomes and identify and develop mitigation strategies to manage project interdependenciesManage relationships with vendors and third party suppliersApplication and demonstration of knowledge and understanding of the projects impact (on people, process and technology)  within the GroupManage and coach Project Managers in the delivery of their assigned projects. Participate in the overall development of Project ManagersManages organisational change requirements with the business and OCM professionals.Evaluate effectiveness of project management tools, processes and methodologies, and make recommendations for continuous improvementIdentifying, monitoring and implementing controls to mitigate key risks on the projectManage and resolve any potential conflict whilst facilitating all aspects of stakeholder relationshipsDrive continuous improvement through process optimisation and automationUndertake any other tasks assigned by your manager that you have the capability to perform safely in line with relevant internal.Your experience /Your qualificationsEssential:Risk Mindset All CommBank employees are expected to proactively identify and understand, openly discuss and act on current and future risks.7+ years formal IT project management experienceApplication and/or infrastructure experienceExperience working in Agile / SCRUM environmentA flexible mindset and approach to project delivery, experimentation and continuous ImprovementStrong communication, negotiation and facilitation skills, with proven ability to influence stakeholdersDesirable:Relevant IT or business related tertiary qualificationsRecognised industry certifications (for example project management methodology)Business Intelligence/Analytics/Data project experienceFinancial Services sector experienceRelevant qualifications relating to AWS and or AzureYour developmentIn this role you will gain experience in:Organisational change (e.g. leading, managing or contributing to a strategic refocus, a restructure, an acquisition/merger or change management)Project management (e.g. managing and/or implementing key projects, applying process excellence methodology, managing cross-business project teams, influencing and negotiating with others)Financial management (e.g. managing a budget, P&L responsibilities, handling complex financial issues or financial reporting/processing)Risk management (e.g. managing financial, customer and reputation risks or risk processing/reporting)People management (e.g. leading a large team, developing others, handling difficult staffing and customer situations)External relations (e.g. representing the organisation externally through direct customer contacts or vendor management)Cross cultural (e.g. work overseas, experience working with other cultures or managing virtual team)On the job development opportunities will be identified for you between you and your manager. They will work with you to create and action your development and career plan.
